Articles.Content:
So a while back i found a site by the name of [Luft46.com](http://www.luft46.com). This site is a resource on many experimental, prototypical, and "napkin" design german fighter and bombers.

The challenge is to make planes

--> as accurate as possible to the site 

--> using stock and parts from any mod that does not include procedural parts

--> minor clipping is ok, it just needs to look good

--> Fun

--> blow up keep kerbals safe

Post Pictures Here!

To start off, my rendition of the [FW "Flitzer"](http://www.luft46.com/fw/fwflitz.html)

Flies like a dream

> ![Qp0wUrD.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/Qp0wUrD.jpg?1)
> ![HN90akS.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/HN90akS.jpg?1)
> 
> ![M0DtQt0.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/M0DtQt0.jpg?1)

Ohh I got to go first with my Horten Ho 229 Stealth Bomber made in WWII in which historians say would've changed the course of the war if it was developed as slow as it would've. The wiki page: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horten_Ho_229)

Ohh and I also made a youtube video of it

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BEk4a6OyNDc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
nice i like the bomb drops!

So I tried to make the Lippisch Li P.09

[http://www.luft46.com/lippisch/lip09-1.html](http://www.luft46.com/lippisch/lip09-1.html)

It flies wonderfully.

Suggestions? Comments? Concerns?

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/FEEEt)

And here I thought I was pretty decent at aircraft design in KSP. So, I looked over your challenge and picked 2 of the ones that looked the hardest to fly. The Fighter Project 1 and the FW TA 283. The whole time I was building them I kept thinking, there's no way they'll fly. COM is waaay off the COL and the thrust is waaay too high. Well, I got an education. The FP1 flew great and the TA... well it was a bit of a beast but I was pretty surprised with just the fact that it lifted off the runway on it's own and flew straight.

Kinda like the Gotha tho. I'm partial to tailless designs and surprisingly, even without a rudder, it flew quite nice. In the image I'm testing air brakes to help control pitch and yaw. It didn't really need them though. And yes, it has another engine pod tucked underneath of it.

The Lippish was definitely the most acrobatic of the bunch, I just couldn't figure out how to stuff a Kerbal in the rudder... so it's a drone.
